concept.title: System procedures for storing jar files in a database

conbody.p: SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR, SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR, and SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR are a set of procedures in the SQLJ schema that allow you to store jar files in a database.
Your jar file has two names:

ul.li: A physical name (the name you gave it when you created it)
A name (the identifier you give it when you load it into a particular schema). The name, an SQL92Identifier, can be delimited and must be unique within a schema.

conbody.p: A single schema can store more than one jar file.
For more information on when and how to use these procedures, see the section "Loading classes from a database" in the .
